data:
1
00:02:32,778 --> 00:02:34,279
Oh!

2
00:02:35,448 --> 00:02:36,489
Uhh!

3
00:03:17,615 --> 00:03:18,740
Waah!

4
00:03:18,824 --> 00:03:19,824
Uh!

5
00:04:20,719 --> 00:04:23,513
You are confused, aren't you?
Frightened.

6
00:04:23,597 --> 00:04:25,265
That's all right. I can help you.

7
00:04:25,349 --> 00:04:26,307
Who is this?

8
00:04:26,392 --> 00:04:28,351
I am a doctor.
Now, you must listen to me.

9
00:04:28,436 --> 00:04:31,062
You have lost your memory.
There was an experiment.

10
00:04:31,147 --> 00:04:32,981
Something went wrong.
Your memory was erased.

11
00:04:33,065 --> 00:04:34,023
Do you understand me?

12
00:04:34,108 --> 00:04:36,151
No, I don't understand.
What the hell is going on here?

13
00:04:36,235 --> 00:04:38,736
Just listen. There are people
coming for you even as we speak.

14
00:04:38,821 --> 00:04:41,739
You must not let them find you.
You must leave now.

15
00:04:42,533 --> 00:04:45,285
Hello? Are you there?

16
00:05:44,386 --> 00:05:46,804
Hey, Mr. Murdoch.
The Automat called.

17
00:05:46,889 --> 00:05:49,724
Said you left your wallet there.

18
00:05:49,808 --> 00:05:53,019
I suggest you retrieve it since
you only paid for 3 weeks...

19
00:05:53,103 --> 00:05:54,979
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

20
00:05:57,066 --> 00:05:58,608
I've been here 3 weeks?

21
00:05:58,692 --> 00:06:01,027
It's right there in
black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

22
00:06:01,737 --> 00:06:03,488
Day and date.

23
00:06:04,156 --> 00:06:07,575
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

24
00:06:07,660 --> 00:06:09,452
I'll take care of it when I get back.

25
00:06:09,537 --> 00:06:11,663
See that you do. Only thing
makes you a guest...

26
00:06:11,747 --> 00:06:14,040
in this joint, pal,
is cash on the barrelhead.

27
00:06:38,065 --> 00:06:40,567
House rules.
3 weeks is 3 weeks.

28
00:06:40,651 --> 00:06:43,403
No days off for good behavior.

29
00:06:44,363 --> 00:06:45,405
Uhh!

30
00:07:05,384 --> 00:07:08,970
Mr. Murdoch, yes, where is he?

31
00:07:09,054 --> 00:07:12,765
He... he just left not 5 minutes ago.

32
00:07:15,811 --> 00:07:17,937
Sleep now.

33
00:07:20,065 --> 00:07:24,235
# When marimba rhythms
start to play #

34
00:07:24,320 --> 00:07:26,321
# Dance with me #

35
00:07:26,405 --> 00:07:29,365
# Make me sway #

36
00:07:29,450 --> 00:07:33,536
# Like a lazy ocean
hugs the shore #

37
00:07:33,621 --> 00:07:35,788
# Hold me close #

38
00:07:35,873 --> 00:07:38,583
# Sway me more #

39
00:07:38,667 --> 00:07:42,879
# Like a flower
bending in the breeze #

40
00:07:42,963 --> 00:07:45,340
# Bend with me #

41
00:07:45,424 --> 00:07:48,259
# Sway with ease #

42
00:07:48,344 --> 00:07:52,472
# When we dance
you have a way with me #

43
00:07:52,556 --> 00:07:54,682
# Stay with me #

44
00:07:54,767 --> 00:07:57,226
# Sway with me #

45
00:07:58,103 --> 00:07:59,103
Hey, sweetie!

46
00:08:00,105 --> 00:08:02,148
He said he was your
husband's doctor.

47
00:08:02,232 --> 00:08:03,691
He wanted to speak with you.

48
00:08:24,088 --> 00:08:25,088
Excuse me.

49
00:08:26,924 --> 00:08:28,049
Dr. Sh...

50
00:08:28,133 --> 00:08:31,135
Schreber. Please,
won't you come in?

51
00:08:31,220 --> 00:08:33,304
You must be Emma Murdoch.

52
00:08:34,223 --> 00:08:37,308
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

53
00:08:39,144 --> 00:08:40,853
What is this?

54
00:08:41,814 --> 00:08:45,817
A rather crude experiment...
designed to further my studies.

55
00:08:45,901 --> 00:08:47,026
I don't understand.

56
00:08:47,111 --> 00:08:52,156
You say you're my husband's doctor,
but he never mentioned you to me.

57
00:08:52,241 --> 00:08:53,533
The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch...

58
00:08:53,617 --> 00:08:56,035
John has been coming to
see me for quite some time.

59
00:08:56,120 --> 00:08:59,789
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

60
00:08:59,873 --> 00:09:02,959
stemming from your
marital difficulties.

61
00:09:03,043 --> 00:09:05,211
- John told you what happened?
- Yes.

62
00:09:06,296 --> 00:09:08,548
When was the last time
that you saw him?

63
00:09:08,632 --> 00:09:10,049
3 weeks ago.

64
00:09:10,134 --> 00:09:13,845
He packed a suitcase.
He was very angry at me.

65
00:09:13,929 --> 00:09:16,889
I understand how difficult
this must be for you.

66
00:09:16,974 --> 00:09:18,558
But for John's sake,
I would like you...

67
00:09:18,642 --> 00:09:21,227
to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

68
00:09:21,311 --> 00:09:25,022
It appears that John has suffered
a psychotic break.

69
00:09:25,107 --> 00:09:26,357
Complete memory loss.

70
00:09:27,985 --> 00:09:29,944
He may be delusional.

71
00:09:30,028 --> 00:09:31,904
Even violent.

72
00:09:31,989 --> 00:09:33,406
Emma...

73
00:09:34,700 --> 00:09:37,827
if he were to contact you,
and I suspect he will...

74
00:09:37,911 --> 00:09:40,747
you must call me immediately.
Do you understand?

75
00:09:40,831 --> 00:09:45,126
It is imperative that I be
the first one to reach him.

76
00:09:45,210 --> 00:09:48,546
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

77
00:09:50,466 --> 00:09:52,425
...for himself.

78
00:10:02,561 --> 00:10:04,395
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.

79
00:10:04,480 --> 00:10:07,190
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

80
00:10:07,274 --> 00:10:11,152
Mr... was it
"J"... something... Murdoch?

81
00:10:14,072 --> 00:10:15,239
J. Murdoch.

82
00:10:15,324 --> 00:10:18,826
What's your name? Justin? Jerry?

83
00:10:19,661 --> 00:10:20,912
No.

84
00:10:22,539 --> 00:10:24,582
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

85
00:10:24,666 --> 00:10:26,042
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?

86
00:10:26,126 --> 00:10:27,251
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

87
00:10:27,336 --> 00:10:29,796
Ha ha ha ha!

88
00:10:30,589 --> 00:10:31,589
Hi.

89
00:11:11,463 --> 00:11:12,797
Bumstead.

90
00:11:14,550 --> 00:11:17,677
I told the guy,
"Cash on the barrelhead."

91
00:11:17,761 --> 00:11:21,180
I said, "Listen, 3 weeks is 3 weeks."

92
00:11:21,265 --> 00:11:22,431
Where's our lucky winner?

93
00:11:22,516 --> 00:11:25,309
Upstairs, sir, room, uh, 614.

94
00:11:25,394 --> 00:11:28,104
Another call girl.

95
00:11:28,188 --> 00:11:30,731
"J. Murdoch."

96
00:11:31,900 --> 00:11:33,568
Evening, Husselbeck.

97
00:11:33,652 --> 00:11:34,944
Inspector Bumstead.

98
00:11:35,028 --> 00:11:37,530
Your lace is untied.

99
00:11:37,614 --> 00:11:39,282
Sir.

100
00:11:50,168 --> 00:11:51,627
Am I glad you're here, sir.

101
00:11:51,712 --> 00:11:54,297
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

102
00:11:54,381 --> 00:11:56,674
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

103
00:12:03,932 --> 00:12:07,852
Wow. Looks like somebody
woke up on the wrong side of the bed.

104
00:12:50,896 --> 00:12:53,397
- Hello.
- Oh, it's you.

105
00:12:53,482 --> 00:12:54,815
You left your wallet here, buddy.

106
00:12:54,900 --> 00:12:56,150
When... when, when did I do that?

107
00:12:56,234 --> 00:12:57,318
When you was last here.

108
00:12:57,402 --> 00:13:00,488
- When... when was that?
- When you left your wallet.

109
00:13:00,572 --> 00:13:02,365
You expect me to remember?

110
00:13:05,160 --> 00:13:08,412
Hello. Excuse me.

111
00:13:09,331 --> 00:13:11,248
No, no, seriously.

112
00:13:11,333 --> 00:13:13,042
Heh heh heh.

113
00:13:14,086 --> 00:13:15,503
Alleged?

114
00:13:29,768 --> 00:13:31,852
- Where you headed, chief?
- Home.

115
00:13:31,937 --> 00:13:32,937
And where's home?

116
00:13:33,021 --> 00:13:35,731
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do? Hm?

117
00:13:35,816 --> 00:13:38,025
Well, I'm just trying
to do my job, May.

118
00:13:38,110 --> 00:13:40,152
There's a killer out there
in case you hadn't noticed.

119
00:13:40,237 --> 00:13:42,947
Maybe you should be out looking for him
instead of cooling your heels, huh?

120
00:13:44,074 --> 00:13:46,200
- Ha ha ha.
- He he.

121
00:13:46,284 --> 00:13:47,952
Aw, go on, get out of here.

122
00:13:56,294 --> 00:13:57,294
Come on.

123
00:13:58,463 --> 00:14:00,715
Round and round she goes.

124
00:14:03,135 --> 00:14:07,263
Where she stops? Nobody knows.

125
00:14:10,434 --> 00:14:13,519
What's that make so far, Husselbeck?
6 hookers in all?

126
00:14:13,603 --> 00:14:15,021
I believe so, sir.

127
00:14:15,105 --> 00:14:17,565
Give the man an "A" for effort.

128
00:14:17,649 --> 00:14:19,859
You'd think these stiffs
would have the good grace...

129
00:14:19,943 --> 00:14:22,069
to expire at a good time of night.

130
00:14:23,071 --> 00:14:25,031
Hey, too bad about Walenski, huh?

131
00:14:28,702 --> 00:14:30,244
I guess he'd seen enough.

132
00:14:37,335 --> 00:14:38,335
So, Husselbeck...

133
00:14:39,796 --> 00:14:46,093
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

134
00:14:46,178 --> 00:14:47,136
You've got me, sir.

135
00:14:47,220 --> 00:14:49,305
Bumstead, what took you?

136
00:14:49,389 --> 00:14:52,600
This killer's been running circles
around us thanks to Walenski.

137
00:14:52,684 --> 00:14:54,435
With all due respect,
Chief Inspector...

138
00:14:54,519 --> 00:14:57,438
I've known Eddie a long time.
He's a good cop.

139
00:14:57,522 --> 00:15:01,692
Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was,
he let drift a long time ago.

140
00:15:01,777 --> 00:15:03,569
Let me talk to Bumstead!

141
00:15:03,653 --> 00:15:04,945
Come on, let's go.

142
00:15:05,030 --> 00:15:06,363
Hold on!

143
00:15:06,448 --> 00:15:08,699
Frank, Frank!

144
00:15:08,784 --> 00:15:10,117
Whoa!

145
00:15:10,202 --> 00:15:11,285
Get his arm!

146
00:15:11,369 --> 00:15:12,328
They're watching us!

147
00:15:12,412 --> 00:15:13,412
On your feet.

148
00:15:13,497 --> 00:15:14,872
There's no way out!

149
00:15:14,956 --> 00:15:16,248
Don't make us hurt you.

150
00:15:16,333 --> 00:15:18,042
God, can't you see?!

151
00:15:21,421 --> 00:15:22,713
Let me go, let me go!

152
00:15:22,798 --> 00:15:24,256
I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm not...

153
00:15:25,342 --> 00:15:27,551
- What was that?
- Walenski.

154
00:15:35,936 --> 00:15:39,063
I'm being punished for my sins, right?

155
00:15:39,147 --> 00:15:41,482
What did I ever do to inherit this?

156
00:15:41,566 --> 00:15:42,608
Where do you begin?

157
00:15:42,692 --> 00:15:47,655
Well, everything Detective Walenski
committed to paper should be here, so...

158
00:15:47,739 --> 00:15:51,242
The only thing that should
be committed is Walenski.

159
00:15:52,828 --> 00:15:55,162
Nothing like a little healthy paranoia.

160
00:15:58,708 --> 00:16:01,836
Sir, we just got
the fingerprint results in.

161
00:16:05,215 --> 00:16:06,966
What is this, some kind of joke?

162
00:16:11,221 --> 00:16:12,596
Don't throw anything away.

163
00:16:18,728 --> 00:16:19,812
Inspector Bumstead.

164
00:16:22,107 --> 00:16:24,817
I came here to file
a missing persons report for my husband.

165
00:16:25,610 --> 00:16:27,444
Take it to the front desk.

166
00:16:27,529 --> 00:16:29,363
They told me to come see you.

167
00:16:31,116 --> 00:16:33,325
His name's John Murdoch.

168
00:16:34,369 --> 00:16:37,371
Mrs. Murdoch,
why didn't you report this before?

169
00:16:37,455 --> 00:16:42,585
I mean, if your husband has been missing
as long as you say...

170
00:16:42,669 --> 00:16:45,379
I thought he'd simply
walked out on me.

171
00:16:46,548 --> 00:16:50,467
Then a... doctor contacted me
this evening.

172
00:16:50,552 --> 00:16:52,136
How long have you been married?

173
00:16:52,220 --> 00:16:53,470
Nearly four years.

174
00:16:53,555 --> 00:16:56,432
- Hm.
- Why do you ask?

175
00:16:56,516 --> 00:16:59,560
Because you seem uncomfortable
with your ring.

176
00:16:59,644 --> 00:17:03,272
As if you were...
unaccustomed to wearing it.

177
00:17:03,356 --> 00:17:04,815
No, I never take it off.

178
00:17:11,364 --> 00:17:15,409
Do these names
mean anything to you?

179
00:17:20,749 --> 00:17:22,666
No. Who are these women?

180
00:17:23,543 --> 00:17:25,252
Why are you looking
for my husband?

181
00:17:25,962 --> 00:17:27,755
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

182
00:17:27,839 --> 00:17:30,090
Maybe. Maybe murder.

183
00:17:30,175 --> 00:17:31,217
Whose murder?

184
00:17:32,636 --> 00:17:36,347
- Which one?
- Ha ha. All of them.

185
00:17:37,307 --> 00:17:39,433
Mrs. Murdoch,
I am sorry, I'm sorry.

186
00:17:39,517 --> 00:17:40,559
I didn't mean to alarm you.

187
00:17:40,644 --> 00:17:43,145
I'm so sorry that I came.
Just both made a mistake.

188
00:17:43,230 --> 00:17:44,647
Mrs. Murdoch, if you please.

189
00:17:44,731 --> 00:17:47,191
If you'll just give me
half a second to explain...

190
00:17:49,486 --> 00:17:51,528
I'll be right out.

191
00:18:15,679 --> 00:18:17,930
Have we met before?

192
00:18:18,014 --> 00:18:21,600
If we did...
I hope you're still breathing.

193
00:18:21,685 --> 00:18:23,310
What's your name, honey?

194
00:18:24,980 --> 00:18:26,313
John. Ha ha.

195
00:18:26,398 --> 00:18:28,857
Ha ha. Well,
that's an appropriate name.

196
00:18:29,734 --> 00:18:30,734
Yeah.

197
00:18:36,908 --> 00:18:38,075
I was just thinking.

198
00:18:42,289 --> 00:18:43,872
What you do...

199
00:18:45,083 --> 00:18:48,335
seems kind of dangerous...

200
00:18:48,420 --> 00:18:50,379
right now.

201
00:18:50,463 --> 00:18:52,172
I mean, how do you know
I'm not the killer?

202
00:18:52,257 --> 00:18:55,426
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

203
00:18:56,636 --> 00:18:59,138
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

204
00:18:59,222 --> 00:19:00,347
Heh.

205
00:19:20,702 --> 00:19:22,286
Aw, shoot.

206
00:19:50,148 --> 00:19:51,148
Oh!

207
00:20:20,970 --> 00:20:24,681
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

208
00:20:27,852 --> 00:20:28,852
Who are you?

209
00:20:28,937 --> 00:20:32,564
We might ask
the same question, yes?

210
00:20:32,649 --> 00:20:35,234
Sleep now.

211
00:20:57,715 --> 00:20:59,007
Aah!

212
00:21:02,011 --> 00:21:02,886
He can tune.

213
00:21:08,476 --> 00:21:10,102
Ah!

214
00:21:14,065 --> 00:21:15,566
- Ah!
- Ooph.

215
00:21:23,575 --> 00:21:24,408
Ah!

216
00:21:56,024 --> 00:21:59,276
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

217
00:21:59,360 --> 00:22:01,236
It is said he is able to tune.

218
00:22:01,321 --> 00:22:02,654
Impossible.

219
00:22:02,739 --> 00:22:05,491
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

220
00:22:05,575 --> 00:22:07,951
On occasion the imprinting
does not take.

221
00:22:08,036 --> 00:22:10,954
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

222
00:22:11,039 --> 00:22:14,625
We find them wandering
like lost children.

223
00:22:14,709 --> 00:22:16,835
But this one was different, yes?

224
00:22:16,920 --> 00:22:18,545
What has the doctor
to say about this?

225
00:22:18,630 --> 00:22:20,589
He has failed to report in.

226
00:22:20,673 --> 00:22:23,759
- And Mr. Quick?
- No more Mr. Quick.

227
00:22:23,843 --> 00:22:26,845
Mr. Quick, dead, yes.

228
00:22:29,891 --> 00:22:32,434
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

229
00:22:32,519 --> 00:22:35,395
Mr. Book, does he know?

230
00:22:36,731 --> 00:22:38,565
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

231
00:22:39,526 --> 00:22:42,361
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

232
00:22:42,445 --> 00:22:45,364
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

233
00:22:46,449 --> 00:22:48,951
Mr. Night, you will take the East.

234
00:22:49,035 --> 00:22:51,787
Mr. Face, you the West.

235
00:22:51,871 --> 00:22:53,914
Mr. Glove, the South.

236
00:22:53,998 --> 00:22:56,250
Mr. Shade, the North.

237
00:22:57,794 --> 00:23:00,754
We must have this man.

238
00:23:14,394 --> 00:23:19,398
Do you really think my husband could be
capable of committing those murders?

239
00:23:19,983 --> 00:23:22,025
Do you?

240
00:23:23,069 --> 00:23:26,530
Let's hope, for both our sakes,
that I'm wrong.

241
00:23:54,642 --> 00:23:55,892
John.

242
00:24:10,241 --> 00:24:12,409
I've been so worried about you.

243
00:24:15,788 --> 00:24:17,831
Are you punishing me?

244
00:24:17,915 --> 00:24:20,500
You know, if disappearing
is your way of punishing me...

245
00:24:20,585 --> 00:24:21,627
I don't appreciate it.

246
00:24:21,711 --> 00:24:23,754
I don't know what
you're talking about.

247
00:24:26,591 --> 00:24:29,051
I found these keys in my pocket...

248
00:24:29,135 --> 00:24:31,803
so I assume I live here.

249
00:24:31,888 --> 00:24:33,597
You supposed to be my wife?

250
00:24:33,681 --> 00:24:35,682
Supposed to be?

251
00:24:35,767 --> 00:24:37,768
John.

252
00:24:38,269 --> 00:24:40,020
You really...

253
00:24:40,104 --> 00:24:43,273
don't know who I am, do you?

254
00:24:43,358 --> 00:24:44,524
Your doctor called me.

255
00:24:44,609 --> 00:24:46,026
He was worried
that this might happen.

256
00:24:46,110 --> 00:24:47,569
My doctor?

257
00:24:47,654 --> 00:24:50,155
Yeah. He, uh...

258
00:24:50,239 --> 00:24:52,199
he gave me his card.

259
00:24:52,283 --> 00:24:54,785
He's desperate to find you.

260
00:24:54,869 --> 00:24:57,371
Schreber.

261
00:25:01,709 --> 00:25:03,752
I feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

262
00:25:03,836 --> 00:25:06,630
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

263
00:25:07,340 --> 00:25:09,466
I had an affair.

264
00:25:10,551 --> 00:25:12,969
You were angry at me.

265
00:25:15,431 --> 00:25:17,224
The police are looking for you.

266
00:25:17,308 --> 00:25:19,559
I know. I saw the papers.

267
00:25:19,644 --> 00:25:22,229
"Killer stalks city streetwalkers."

268
00:25:25,733 --> 00:25:29,277
I was with one of those women...

269
00:25:29,362 --> 00:25:31,154
before I came here tonight.

270
00:25:31,823 --> 00:25:33,448
I don't understand.

271
00:25:33,533 --> 00:25:34,991
I... I met her outside an Automat.

272
00:25:36,494 --> 00:25:39,037
I guess I wanted to test myself.

273
00:25:39,122 --> 00:25:42,999
I wanted to know if I had it in me
to do those things.

274
00:25:43,084 --> 00:25:47,671
Maybe I have lost my mind, but whoever
I am, I'm still me and I'm not a killer.

275
00:25:54,011 --> 00:25:56,012
I believe you.

276
00:25:56,889 --> 00:25:59,057
You do?

277
00:26:02,270 --> 00:26:03,228
What?

278
00:26:03,312 --> 00:26:06,064
The car outside,
the one you arrived in.

279
00:26:06,149 --> 00:26:08,442
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

280
00:26:10,611 --> 00:26:13,196
I didn't know he was still here.

281
00:26:13,281 --> 00:26:14,322
John.

282
00:26:15,616 --> 00:26:18,368
Hold it right there, mister!

283
00:26:19,746 --> 00:26:21,663
Wait. You have the wrong man.

284
00:26:21,748 --> 00:26:22,831
Stand aside, will you, please?

285
00:26:22,915 --> 00:26:24,458
I didn't kill anyone.

286
00:26:24,542 --> 00:26:27,669
Right now what you are
is a suspect. Turn yourself in.

287
00:26:28,588 --> 00:26:30,130
I'll listen to whatever
you have to say.

288
00:26:30,214 --> 00:26:32,090
You're not gonna believe
what I have to say.

289
00:26:33,217 --> 00:26:34,301
Try me.

290
00:26:34,886 --> 00:26:36,428
There's someone after me.

291
00:26:36,512 --> 00:26:39,598
There's this... this group of men.
They want me dead.

292
00:26:39,682 --> 00:26:42,309
And I don't even know if...
They're not even...

293
00:26:43,060 --> 00:26:45,270
Yeah, who's gonna
listen to a madman?

294
00:26:45,354 --> 00:26:47,105
Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.

295
00:26:47,190 --> 00:26:48,315
Run!

296
00:26:52,153 --> 00:26:54,905
No one ever listens to me.

297
00:27:00,411 --> 00:27:01,578
Murdoch, stop!

298
00:27:06,626 --> 00:27:08,001
Murdoch!

299
00:27:44,205 --> 00:27:45,163
How much further?

300
00:27:45,248 --> 00:27:46,790
We're almost there, buddy.

301
00:27:49,460 --> 00:27:52,712
Hey, you happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

302
00:27:52,797 --> 00:27:55,674
You're kidding. Me and the missus
spent our honeymoon there.

303
00:27:55,758 --> 00:27:58,468
All you gotta do is take
Main Street west to...

304
00:28:01,305 --> 00:28:02,973
Or is it the cross...

305
00:28:03,057 --> 00:28:06,643
You know, that's funny.
I... I can't seem to remember...

306
00:28:06,727 --> 00:28:09,020
if it's Main Street west
or the cross-town.

307
00:28:13,693 --> 00:28:17,195
I'm sorry, Inspector,
I cannot be of more assistance...

308
00:28:17,280 --> 00:28:19,072
but I am running late
for an appointment.

309
00:28:19,156 --> 00:28:21,366
Well, I appreciate
your taking the time.

310
00:28:29,667 --> 00:28:31,918
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

311
00:28:32,003 --> 00:28:36,631
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

312
00:28:36,716 --> 00:28:39,342
Murdoch doesn't strike me as one.

313
00:28:39,427 --> 00:28:43,054
Perhaps you are not
accustomed to digging deep enough.

314
00:28:43,139 --> 00:28:45,599
Well, I do know when someone
is lying to me, Doctor.

315
00:28:45,683 --> 00:28:48,268
Forgive me, Inspector,
but you are not a clinician.

316
00:28:48,352 --> 00:28:52,063
Judging personalities
happens to be my business.

317
00:28:52,148 --> 00:28:54,107
Well, maybe you could
give me a few pointers.

318
00:28:54,191 --> 00:28:55,984
Certainly.

319
00:28:56,068 --> 00:28:58,069
Let's take you, for instance.

320
00:28:58,154 --> 00:29:01,448
You are a fastidious man, driven.

321
00:29:01,532 --> 00:29:03,617
Consumed by details.

322
00:29:04,368 --> 00:29:06,286
I would say your life is...

323
00:29:07,580 --> 00:29:08,580
rather lonely.

324
00:29:09,373 --> 00:29:11,958
Good evening, Inspector.
I really must be going.

325
00:29:53,334 --> 00:29:57,671
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

326
00:30:04,428 --> 00:30:05,428
Dr. Schreber.

327
00:30:07,223 --> 00:30:11,851
Most unfortunate it is that we were
forced to seek you out here.

328
00:30:12,770 --> 00:30:15,438
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this...

329
00:30:16,148 --> 00:30:17,440
moisture.

330
00:30:17,858 --> 00:30:20,986
- I'm sorry. I...
- Failed to report in, yes.

331
00:30:21,070 --> 00:30:23,655
I was frightened.
I... I have a weak heart, you know.

332
00:30:23,739 --> 00:30:27,534
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

333
00:30:27,618 --> 00:30:30,245
We found this
in his hotel room.

334
00:30:30,329 --> 00:30:34,207
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

335
00:30:34,291 --> 00:30:35,333
I tried to imprint him...

336
00:30:35,418 --> 00:30:37,502
but he woke up, he knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

337
00:30:37,586 --> 00:30:39,629
I tried to stop him but he was too fast.

338
00:30:39,714 --> 00:30:40,839
He has no memories, then?

339
00:30:40,923 --> 00:30:44,217
Only fragments.
The procedure, it was interrupted.

340
00:30:44,301 --> 00:30:48,054
I... I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

341
00:30:48,139 --> 00:30:49,681
You have had strays
before, right?

342
00:30:49,765 --> 00:30:53,393
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can tune.

343
00:30:53,811 --> 00:30:56,563
But that's impossible.
I thought only you had that ability.

344
00:30:56,647 --> 00:31:00,900
You will process another template
of the subject's memories, yes?

345
00:31:00,985 --> 00:31:02,694
Of course. I'll imprint him again.

346
00:31:02,778 --> 00:31:07,282
No. We require them
for a quite different purpose.

347
00:31:08,117 --> 00:31:10,535
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

348
00:31:10,619 --> 00:31:13,038
We'll talk again
after tonight's tuning, but...

349
00:31:13,622 --> 00:31:15,373
no more delays, yes?

350
00:31:15,458 --> 00:31:20,170
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

351
00:31:27,762 --> 00:31:30,638
You appear quite frail, Doctor.

352
00:31:31,390 --> 00:31:34,893
Perhaps some exercise
would do you good.

353
00:31:48,532 --> 00:31:49,699
- Come in.
- Kate.

354
00:31:54,789 --> 00:31:56,456
- How is he?
- The same.

355
00:31:57,833 --> 00:32:00,418
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

356
00:32:06,759 --> 00:32:08,259
Come in, Frank.

357
00:32:11,138 --> 00:32:13,056
Close the door.

358
00:32:20,481 --> 00:32:23,817
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

359
00:32:23,901 --> 00:32:25,902
It's an interesting case.

360
00:32:27,071 --> 00:32:31,866
The kind that can make
a man's career...

361
00:32:31,951 --> 00:32:33,118
or break it.

362
00:32:33,202 --> 00:32:35,495
Yeah, I was on that case.

363
00:32:35,579 --> 00:32:39,791
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

364
00:32:39,875 --> 00:32:41,668
Nothing happened, Frank.

365
00:32:41,752 --> 00:32:45,839
I've just been spending time
on the subway, riding in circles.

366
00:32:45,923 --> 00:32:47,799
Thinking in circles.

367
00:32:48,717 --> 00:32:49,801
There's no way out.

368
00:32:51,595 --> 00:32:53,471
I've been over every inch
of this city.

369
00:32:58,227 --> 00:33:00,520
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

370
00:33:00,604 --> 00:33:02,313
She's not my wife.

371
00:33:03,816 --> 00:33:06,734
I don't know who she is.
I don't know who any of us are.

372
00:33:06,819 --> 00:33:08,695
What makes you say that?

373
00:33:08,779 --> 00:33:10,864
Do you think about
the past much, Frank?

374
00:33:12,324 --> 00:33:13,783
As much as the next guy.

375
00:33:14,410 --> 00:33:17,495
See, I've been trying
to remember things...

376
00:33:17,580 --> 00:33:20,206
clearly remember things
from my past.

377
00:33:20,291 --> 00:33:25,712
But the more I try to think back,
the more it all starts to unravel.

378
00:33:25,796 --> 00:33:27,046
None of it seems real.

379
00:33:27,131 --> 00:33:30,466
It's like I've just been
dreaming this life...

380
00:33:30,551 --> 00:33:34,053
and when I finally wake up
I'll be somebody else.

381
00:33:34,138 --> 00:33:35,972
Somebody totally different.

382
00:33:40,728 --> 00:33:43,396
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie?

383
00:33:43,480 --> 00:33:46,482
Something to do with the case.

384
00:33:47,067 --> 00:33:50,486
There is no case.
There never was!

385
00:33:50,571 --> 00:33:54,991
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

386
00:34:35,491 --> 00:34:38,201
Tonight's requirements are...

387
00:34:38,285 --> 00:34:42,997
12 family photo albums,
9 personal diaries...

388
00:34:43,082 --> 00:34:47,961
17 love letters,
assorted childhood photographs...

389
00:34:48,045 --> 00:34:52,131
26 wallets,
ID's and social security cards.

390
00:34:52,216 --> 00:34:54,300
These do bring back memories.

391
00:34:56,679 --> 00:34:58,846
This one is still warm.

392
00:34:58,931 --> 00:35:00,682
What is it?

393
00:35:00,766 --> 00:35:03,935
The recollections of a great lover?

394
00:35:04,019 --> 00:35:06,980
A catalog of conquests?

395
00:35:07,064 --> 00:35:08,564
We will soon find out.

396
00:35:09,942 --> 00:35:14,529
You wouldn't appreciate that,
would you, Mr. Whatever your name is?

397
00:35:14,613 --> 00:35:18,992
Not the sort of conquests
you would ever understand.

398
00:35:19,952 --> 00:35:20,994
Let's see.

399
00:35:22,288 --> 00:35:24,998
A touch of unhappy childhood.

400
00:35:27,167 --> 00:35:28,501
Ahh.

401
00:35:30,838 --> 00:35:33,548
A dash of teenage rebellion.

402
00:35:35,301 --> 00:35:38,052
And last, but not least...

403
00:35:38,137 --> 00:35:40,346
a tragic death in the family.

404
00:35:40,431 --> 00:35:41,431
Doctor.

405
00:35:43,600 --> 00:35:44,684
Mr. Book.

406
00:35:46,645 --> 00:35:47,979
Whoa!

407
00:35:48,063 --> 00:35:52,066
Aah! Aah! Ah! Ah!

408
00:35:52,151 --> 00:35:53,860
Why does Murdoch not sleep...

409
00:35:53,944 --> 00:35:55,778
during the tuning as the others do?

410
00:35:55,863 --> 00:35:59,949
I don't know. Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

411
00:36:00,034 --> 00:36:02,869
A... A freak of nature.
He's adapting to survive.

412
00:36:02,953 --> 00:36:06,289
What do you expect?
Weren't you looking for the human soul?

413
00:36:06,373 --> 00:36:08,875
That's the purpose
of your little zoo, isn't it?

414
00:36:08,959 --> 00:36:12,253
That's why you keep changing people
and things around every night.

415
00:36:12,338 --> 00:36:15,381
Maybe you have finally found
what you are looking for...

416
00:36:15,466 --> 00:36:16,632
and it's going
to bite you on your...

417
00:36:16,717 --> 00:36:18,301
Ah!

418
00:36:20,637 --> 00:36:24,223
It requires several of your lifetimes
to master our gifts.

419
00:36:24,308 --> 00:36:28,144
The idea that a simple man
could develop the ability to tune...

420
00:36:28,228 --> 00:36:29,729
Is absurd, I know...

421
00:36:29,813 --> 00:36:31,814
but what other
explanation is there?

422
00:36:36,653 --> 00:36:38,654
It is time.

423
00:37:23,826 --> 00:37:25,201
Shut it down.

424
00:37:40,843 --> 00:37:42,218
Get your paper right here!

425
00:37:53,730 --> 00:37:55,398
It's driving me crazy.

426
00:37:55,482 --> 00:37:56,858
I can't sleep.

427
00:37:56,942 --> 00:37:58,693
And they call my job "unskilled".

428
00:37:58,777 --> 00:38:00,027
You think you've got it tough?

429
00:38:00,112 --> 00:38:01,988
You try looking after these kids,
for a change.

430
00:38:02,906 --> 00:38:07,034
Anyways, Frederickson says he'll
take me off the damn night shift soon.

431
00:38:07,578 --> 00:38:09,454
Well, it's about time, dear.

432
00:39:25,239 --> 00:39:26,239
Hello?

433
00:39:29,076 --> 00:39:30,159
Hello?!

434
00:39:34,456 --> 00:39:35,831
Wake up!

435
00:39:35,916 --> 00:39:36,916
Hey!

436
00:39:39,294 --> 00:39:40,586
Wake up!

437
00:39:40,671 --> 00:39:42,588
Wake up!

438
00:39:44,258 --> 00:39:46,175
Wake up!

439
00:39:47,553 --> 00:39:49,303
Hello?!

440
00:39:50,681 --> 00:39:54,725
Can anybody hear me?!

441
00:39:55,811 --> 00:39:59,272
Let the tuning commence.

442
00:42:38,849 --> 00:42:41,851
The Goodwins.
Jeremy, Sylvia...

443
00:42:41,935 --> 00:42:44,228
Jane and little Matthew.

444
00:42:48,024 --> 00:42:50,109
Jane and little Matthew.

445
00:43:20,223 --> 00:43:22,850
The rich get richer.

446
00:43:22,934 --> 00:43:26,562
Probably have maid's quarters
before the night is through.

447
00:44:19,783 --> 00:44:21,617
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

448
00:44:22,118 --> 00:44:23,077
It's you.

449
00:44:23,161 --> 00:44:24,537
Hey, come on.

450
00:44:24,621 --> 00:44:26,747
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor.

451
00:44:26,832 --> 00:44:28,541
If that's what you are,
huh, Doctor?

452
00:44:28,625 --> 00:44:30,000
Mr. Murdoch, please, I...

453
00:44:30,085 --> 00:44:31,877
What is happening here?
Why is everyone asleep?

454
00:44:31,962 --> 00:44:34,296
Shh. Please keep your voice down.

455
00:44:34,381 --> 00:44:36,257
Why can't I remember anything?
What have you done to me?

456
00:44:36,341 --> 00:44:39,051
Nothing, nothing.
Please, I want to help you.

457
00:44:39,135 --> 00:44:40,386
We can't talk here.

458
00:44:40,470 --> 00:44:42,638
It is not safe.
If they see us together, they'll...

459
00:44:42,722 --> 00:44:44,098
I don't care.
I want some answers.

460
00:44:44,182 --> 00:44:45,474
I want some answers now!

461
00:44:45,559 --> 00:44:46,684
Who are they?

462
00:44:46,768 --> 00:44:48,644
Why are they trying to kill me?

463
00:44:48,728 --> 00:44:49,895
- Answer me!
- Oh!

464
00:44:55,151 --> 00:44:58,237
My God. You really can do it.

465
00:44:58,321 --> 00:44:59,572
I did that?

466
00:44:59,656 --> 00:45:01,866
Listen to me, John.
You have their power.

467
00:45:01,950 --> 00:45:03,993
You can make things happen
by will alone.

468
00:45:04,077 --> 00:45:07,329
They call it tuning. That is how they make
the buildings change.

469
00:45:07,414 --> 00:45:09,915
Just now you acted out
of self-defense. A reflex.

470
00:45:10,000 --> 00:45:12,793
But I can teach you to control
your power consciously.

471
00:45:12,878 --> 00:45:15,170
Let me help you, John.
Together we can stop them.

472
00:45:15,255 --> 00:45:16,839
We can take the city back.

473
00:45:20,093 --> 00:45:20,885
My glasses.

474
00:45:23,346 --> 00:45:25,306
My glasses, please.

475
00:46:12,395 --> 00:46:15,022
He made a terrible
impression for the firm...

476
00:46:15,106 --> 00:46:17,399
lollygagging around as he did.

477
00:46:17,484 --> 00:46:20,319
So I simply told Frederickson
I was going to have to let him go.

478
00:46:20,403 --> 00:46:23,113
And well you should have, darling.

479
00:46:23,448 --> 00:46:24,823
He attacked me.

480
00:46:25,784 --> 00:46:27,034
I don't know where he has gone.

481
00:46:28,119 --> 00:46:29,995
Come, Dr. Schreber.

482
00:46:31,039 --> 00:46:32,581
We have much to do.

483
00:46:32,666 --> 00:46:34,416
Yes?

484
00:46:34,960 --> 00:46:36,126
Yes.

485
00:46:51,142 --> 00:46:58,691
# They say that you're
a run-around lover #

486
00:46:58,775 --> 00:47:02,653
# Though you say #

487
00:47:02,737 --> 00:47:06,615
# It isn't so #

488
00:47:09,786 --> 00:47:15,582
# But if you put me down
for another #

489
00:47:17,919 --> 00:47:20,087
# I'll know #

490
00:47:20,171 --> 00:47:24,633
# Believe me, I'll know #

491
00:47:26,302 --> 00:47:30,139
# 'Cause the night #

492
00:47:30,223 --> 00:47:34,143
# Has a thousand eyes #

493
00:47:35,061 --> 00:47:38,939
# And a thousand eyes #

494
00:47:39,024 --> 00:47:42,317
# Can't tell, but see #

495
00:47:44,654 --> 00:47:51,243
# If you are true to me #

496
00:47:52,954 --> 00:47:56,957
# So remember #

497
00:47:57,042 --> 00:48:02,713
# When you tell those little white lies #

498
00:48:02,797 --> 00:48:13,223
# That the night
has a thousand eyes #

499
00:48:16,352 --> 00:48:20,606
# A thousand eyes #

500
00:48:22,859 --> 00:48:24,693
Whoo!

501
00:48:27,363 --> 00:48:30,824
Tonight's experiment shall be conducted
in the following locations.

502
00:48:30,909 --> 00:48:35,287
The first subject
shall be imprinted here on Avenue M.

503
00:48:35,371 --> 00:48:37,831
Mr. Book. There is a... a problem.

504
00:48:37,916 --> 00:48:41,210
There is no Avenue M.
We were unable to complete it.

505
00:48:41,294 --> 00:48:44,963
During the last tuning
we detected a lack of control.

506
00:48:45,048 --> 00:48:47,674
An opposing influence
on the machines?

507
00:48:47,759 --> 00:48:52,471
Then this man Murdoch
is more powerful than we thought.

508
00:48:52,555 --> 00:48:54,264
He's becoming like us.

509
00:48:54,349 --> 00:48:58,852
So we must become like him.

510
00:48:58,937 --> 00:49:01,313
The good doctor
has done as we asked?

511
00:49:01,397 --> 00:49:04,691
The life and times
of John Murdoch, Volume 2.

512
00:49:07,070 --> 00:49:09,321
We must not do this.

513
00:49:09,405 --> 00:49:12,908
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

514
00:49:12,992 --> 00:49:15,619
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

515
00:49:15,703 --> 00:49:17,996
Everywhere he goes...

516
00:49:18,081 --> 00:49:20,666
everyone he seeks out
will be known to us.

517
00:49:20,750 --> 00:49:25,671
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

518
00:49:25,755 --> 00:49:28,382
Perhaps we have forgotten
what happened last time, when we t...

519
00:49:28,466 --> 00:49:31,552
Yes. Poor, poor Mr...

520
00:49:31,636 --> 00:49:33,470
We have not forgotten.

521
00:49:33,555 --> 00:49:40,811
If Mr. Hand wishes to make this sacrifice
for the greater good...

522
00:49:41,437 --> 00:49:42,855
so be it.

523
00:49:42,939 --> 00:49:48,068
But to imprint one of us.
Failure has always resulted.

524
00:49:48,153 --> 00:49:51,655
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

525
00:49:51,739 --> 00:49:53,157
Imprint.

526
00:49:58,830 --> 00:50:00,622
This may sting a bit.

527
00:50:02,625 --> 00:50:03,625
Ah!

528
00:50:04,669 --> 00:50:05,669
Aah!

529
00:50:18,600 --> 00:50:19,600
Ah.

530
00:50:37,452 --> 00:50:39,328
Is it done?

531
00:50:40,079 --> 00:50:42,623
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

532
00:50:43,541 --> 00:50:47,085
I have John Murdoch... in mind.

533
00:50:51,841 --> 00:50:53,050
"Johnny...

534
00:50:53,801 --> 00:50:57,221
"I found this postcard
among your mother's things.

535
00:50:57,305 --> 00:50:59,389
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

536
00:50:59,474 --> 00:51:01,266
"Stop by sometime.

537
00:51:01,351 --> 00:51:03,101
"We'll see if we
can't hook ourselves...

538
00:51:03,186 --> 00:51:04,478
"another mermaid.

539
00:51:04,562 --> 00:51:06,521
"Love to Emma. Karl."

540
00:51:12,403 --> 00:51:13,987
Karl.

541
00:51:15,240 --> 00:51:16,990
Karl Harris.

542
00:51:25,291 --> 00:51:26,667
Harris.

543
00:51:27,126 --> 00:51:28,585
Harris.

544
00:51:30,838 --> 00:51:32,714
"Harris Karl."

545
00:51:34,676 --> 00:51:37,469
Excuse me. Can you tell
me the way to Avenue C?

546
00:51:37,553 --> 00:51:38,762
Try the subway.

547
00:51:42,767 --> 00:51:44,309
You got a problem, pal?

548
00:51:44,394 --> 00:51:47,312
You, uh, been working here long?

549
00:51:48,398 --> 00:51:52,776
25 years. No days off
for good behavior.

550
00:52:08,584 --> 00:52:10,794
Mm! Mmm! Mm!

551
00:52:10,878 --> 00:52:15,007
Mm! Mm! Mm! Mm!

552
00:52:16,801 --> 00:52:19,970
We're looking for John Murdoch.

553
00:52:20,179 --> 00:52:21,179
Mmm!

554
00:52:51,627 --> 00:52:52,711
Shhhh.

555
00:52:52,795 --> 00:52:53,879
Ah. Ah.

556
00:52:53,963 --> 00:52:56,006
She knows nothing, Mr. Hand.

557
00:52:56,090 --> 00:52:58,175
A dead end, yes, Mr. Wall.

558
00:52:58,259 --> 00:53:00,802
We thought his imprint would
allow us to track him, yes...

559
00:53:00,887 --> 00:53:03,263
but instead we have
been brought here.

560
00:53:03,348 --> 00:53:04,931
This is irrational.

561
00:53:05,016 --> 00:53:07,309
Instincts are irrational, Mr. Wall...

562
00:53:07,393 --> 00:53:10,771
and we must follow
where they lead, yes.

563
00:53:10,855 --> 00:53:15,317
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar... his job.

564
00:53:15,401 --> 00:53:17,402
He does not care about our job.

565
00:53:17,487 --> 00:53:20,280
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

566
00:53:20,365 --> 00:53:21,948
If you were Murdoch...

567
00:53:22,033 --> 00:53:22,991
Yes.

568
00:53:23,076 --> 00:53:24,951
If...

569
00:53:25,036 --> 00:53:26,620
I were Murdoch...

570
00:53:28,247 --> 00:53:30,082
I would remember...

571
00:53:30,166 --> 00:53:33,752
how my wife had hurt me
by sleeping with another man.

572
00:53:35,338 --> 00:53:36,797
And then...

573
00:53:38,508 --> 00:53:42,010
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

574
00:53:45,681 --> 00:53:48,016
Leave me alone with her.

575
00:53:48,101 --> 00:53:49,851
There's work to be done.

576
00:53:53,356 --> 00:53:55,607
All change, platform 3.

577
00:53:55,691 --> 00:53:58,485
Platform 3, all change.

578
00:53:58,569 --> 00:54:00,237
All change? Excuse me.

579
00:54:00,321 --> 00:54:01,613
How do I get to the end of the line?

580
00:54:01,697 --> 00:54:03,240
You want the Express.

581
00:54:10,998 --> 00:54:14,209
No trains leave
on platform 7.

582
00:54:14,293 --> 00:54:15,627
- You want platform 2.
- Got it. Thanks a lot.

583
00:54:15,711 --> 00:54:16,670
Hey!

584
00:54:16,754 --> 00:54:18,171
How come that train didn't stop?

585
00:54:18,256 --> 00:54:19,756
That's the Express.

586
00:54:21,092 --> 00:54:22,968
There's no way out, you know?

587
00:54:23,052 --> 00:54:25,971
You can't get out of the city.
Believe me, I've tried.

588
00:54:27,056 --> 00:54:28,723
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

589
00:54:29,183 --> 00:54:30,892
The one they've been looking for.

590
00:54:30,977 --> 00:54:32,811
- Who are you?
- Used to be a cop.

591
00:54:33,521 --> 00:54:35,981
At least, in this life, I was.

592
00:54:36,399 --> 00:54:38,483
They steal people's
memories, you know?

593
00:54:39,026 --> 00:54:40,819
Then they swap them around
between us.

594
00:54:40,903 --> 00:54:43,530
I've seen them do it.
Back and forth, back and forth...

595
00:54:43,614 --> 00:54:45,657
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

596
00:54:45,741 --> 00:54:46,992
How do you know all this?

597
00:54:47,076 --> 00:54:51,329
Once in a while, one of us wakes up
while they're changing things.

598
00:54:51,414 --> 00:54:53,623
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

599
00:54:53,708 --> 00:54:55,667
It happened to me.

600
00:54:55,751 --> 00:54:57,669
They'll come looking for you, Murdoch.

601
00:54:58,796 --> 00:55:00,422
Just like they'll come looking for me.

602
00:55:01,257 --> 00:55:02,507
But that's OK.

603
00:55:02,592 --> 00:55:04,009
I figured a way out.

604
00:55:15,480 --> 00:55:16,813
They were here.

605
00:55:18,691 --> 00:55:19,941
Last night.

606
00:55:20,026 --> 00:55:22,319
This was to be his home.

607
00:55:23,696 --> 00:55:24,988
Ah.

608
00:55:25,072 --> 00:55:26,865
That was when we loved her.

609
00:55:26,949 --> 00:55:28,783
This is all well and good, Mr. Hand...

610
00:55:28,868 --> 00:55:33,371
But we require a more practical link
to his present whereabouts.

611
00:55:36,042 --> 00:55:37,292
Yes.

612
00:55:38,544 --> 00:55:40,879
And I know where to find her.

613
00:55:48,721 --> 00:55:51,598
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

614
00:55:51,682 --> 00:55:52,641
I'm sorry?

615
00:55:52,725 --> 00:55:56,978
To be able to revisit those places
which have meant so very much to us.

616
00:55:57,813 --> 00:55:59,856
I thought it was more
that we were haunted by them.

617
00:55:59,941 --> 00:56:01,942
Perhaps.

618
00:56:03,528 --> 00:56:05,612
But imagine a life...

619
00:56:05,696 --> 00:56:08,281
alien to yours...

620
00:56:08,366 --> 00:56:10,033
in which your memories
were not your own...

621
00:56:10,117 --> 00:56:13,662
but those shared
by every other of your kind.

622
00:56:14,413 --> 00:56:18,667
Imagine the torment
of such an existence...

623
00:56:18,751 --> 00:56:21,211
no experiences to call your own.

624
00:56:23,839 --> 00:56:26,049
If it was all you knew...

625
00:56:26,133 --> 00:56:27,842
maybe it would be a comfort.

626
00:56:28,511 --> 00:56:31,221
But if you were to discover
something different...

627
00:56:32,473 --> 00:56:34,849
Something... better.

628
00:56:38,938 --> 00:56:41,523
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

629
00:56:41,607 --> 00:56:43,316
Biggest thing you ever saw.

630
00:56:43,401 --> 00:56:46,528
Lit up like a floating birthday cake.

631
00:56:47,780 --> 00:56:49,990
That's just what my husband
once said to me...

632
00:56:50,074 --> 00:56:51,908
on this very spot.

633
00:56:53,244 --> 00:56:55,078
Where is your husband now?

634
00:56:55,162 --> 00:56:58,665
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

635
00:56:59,458 --> 00:57:02,294
I met my wife at this place.

636
00:57:02,378 --> 00:57:04,129
It's where I first met my husband.

637
00:57:04,213 --> 00:57:06,464
Small world.

638
00:57:27,153 --> 00:57:30,655
Grr! Ha! No, no, no.

639
00:58:00,394 --> 00:58:01,811
Hello?

640
00:58:02,521 --> 00:58:03,688
Hello?

641
00:58:39,308 --> 00:58:40,225
Oh!

642
00:58:40,309 --> 00:58:41,601
Aah!

643
00:58:41,686 --> 00:58:44,354
Ah! Ah! Ah!

644
00:58:48,901 --> 00:58:50,193
What are you doing here?

645
00:58:50,277 --> 00:58:52,153
I've been following you.

646
00:58:56,033 --> 00:58:57,867
Hold it right there!

647
00:58:59,954 --> 00:59:01,329
Johnny?

648
00:59:01,789 --> 00:59:03,498
Johnny!

649
00:59:03,582 --> 00:59:04,791
It's been so damn long...

650
00:59:04,875 --> 00:59:07,711
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

651
00:59:08,504 --> 00:59:11,089
You son of a gun!
Ha ha ha ha!

652
00:59:11,173 --> 00:59:13,258
Ah ha ha ha ha ha!

653
00:59:13,342 --> 00:59:14,843
Uncle Karl?

654
00:59:18,347 --> 00:59:19,472
Wait.

655
00:59:21,600 --> 00:59:23,101
Is that me?

656
00:59:23,185 --> 00:59:24,352
Yeah.

657
00:59:33,404 --> 00:59:35,405
Shell Beach is where I grew up?

658
00:59:35,489 --> 00:59:36,614
That's what I said.

659
00:59:36,699 --> 00:59:38,992
Shell Beach, your hometown.

660
00:59:39,076 --> 00:59:42,245
I need to get there, Karl.
How do I get there?

661
00:59:42,329 --> 00:59:43,913
I don't know.

662
00:59:43,998 --> 00:59:47,000
- I haven't been there in years.
- Come on. You must remember.

663
00:59:47,084 --> 00:59:49,085
You gotta have some idea.

664
00:59:49,170 --> 00:59:50,295
Come on!

665
00:59:50,379 --> 00:59:51,963
Uh, sorry, Johnny.

666
00:59:53,424 --> 00:59:56,342
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

667
00:59:59,889 --> 01:00:01,473
So bright there.

668
01:00:01,557 --> 01:00:03,850
Brighter times, I guess.

669
01:00:05,561 --> 01:00:07,937
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

670
01:00:08,481 --> 01:00:11,065
That's me and your pa. Ha!

671
01:00:11,150 --> 01:00:13,318
What a couple of handsome fools.

672
01:00:14,487 --> 01:00:15,653
What happened to my parents?

673
01:00:20,576 --> 01:00:21,785
Where are they now?

674
01:00:22,745 --> 01:00:24,704
They're dead, Johnny.

675
01:00:24,789 --> 01:00:27,165
They died when their house
burnt down.

676
01:00:27,249 --> 01:00:28,917
I looked after you.

677
01:00:29,919 --> 01:00:31,836
You don't remember that, really?

678
01:00:35,132 --> 01:00:36,466
What's that?

679
01:00:36,550 --> 01:00:38,927
- Huh?
- What is that?

680
01:00:43,641 --> 01:00:45,308
It's a scar.

681
01:00:45,392 --> 01:00:47,977
You burnt your arm
pretty bad in the fire.

682
01:00:53,526 --> 01:00:56,820
- What does it mean, Johnny?
- It means these are all lies!

683
01:01:00,741 --> 01:01:02,700
Why are you here, Mrs. Murdoch?

684
01:01:11,836 --> 01:01:14,295
My husband told me
he'd been here.

685
01:01:18,133 --> 01:01:20,426
He told me he wanted
to test himself...

686
01:01:21,637 --> 01:01:23,930
see if he was...

687
01:01:24,014 --> 01:01:25,974
capable of...

688
01:01:35,192 --> 01:01:38,987
I wanted to talk to her. I thought maybe
she could help me find him.

689
01:01:40,197 --> 01:01:42,657
Stay here.
I'm gonna call the station.

690
01:01:54,003 --> 01:01:59,132
Yeah, this is Bumstead. Send the
homicide coroner to 1440... East, yeah.

691
01:01:59,508 --> 01:02:02,176
There's been another one.

692
01:02:02,261 --> 01:02:05,471
It's the same pattern.
I'll explain when you get here.

693
01:02:15,274 --> 01:02:17,442
Oh, God.

694
01:02:17,526 --> 01:02:19,694
It's OK. I won't hurt you.

695
01:02:20,112 --> 01:02:21,654
It's OK.

696
01:02:31,749 --> 01:02:33,666
Where the hell did she come from?

697
01:02:33,751 --> 01:02:35,251
I found her hiding.

698
01:02:36,003 --> 01:02:37,837
She saw what happened here.

699
01:03:04,907 --> 01:03:07,909
Are you ready to go home, Mrs. Murdoch?

700
01:03:07,993 --> 01:03:10,620
The inspector is gonna take me. Thanks.

701
01:03:35,562 --> 01:03:36,813
It's beautiful.

702
01:03:39,400 --> 01:03:42,652
It was a gift from my mother.

703
01:03:42,736 --> 01:03:45,196
She died recently.

704
01:03:45,280 --> 01:03:47,615
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

705
01:03:49,535 --> 01:03:50,910
I'm sorry.

706
01:03:54,331 --> 01:03:56,457
It's a funny thing, though.

707
01:03:56,542 --> 01:03:58,918
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

708
01:04:01,463 --> 01:04:04,465
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

709
01:04:06,635 --> 01:04:10,805
Do you think about the past much,
Mrs. Murdoch?

710
01:04:12,975 --> 01:04:15,727
What's happening, Inspector?

711
01:04:15,811 --> 01:04:18,479
I'm not sure I know anymore.

712
01:04:22,026 --> 01:04:24,569
I left your old room like it was.

713
01:04:24,653 --> 01:04:26,738
You can sleep here tonight, huh?

714
01:04:26,822 --> 01:04:29,073
Glad to have you back, Johnny...

715
01:04:29,158 --> 01:04:30,783
even if it is for just a night.

716
01:04:30,868 --> 01:04:32,910
- Karl.
- Huh?

717
01:04:32,995 --> 01:04:34,203
Is that the right time?

718
01:04:34,288 --> 01:04:38,124
Why, sure. That clock's
kept perfect time since I bought it.

719
01:04:38,208 --> 01:04:40,001
A.m. or p.m.?

720
01:04:41,170 --> 01:04:42,587
What do you think, Johnny?

721
01:04:42,671 --> 01:04:44,589
I don't understand.
How can it be night already?

722
01:04:44,673 --> 01:04:46,340
What happened to the day?
How'd I miss it?

723
01:04:46,425 --> 01:04:49,260
You're tired. Anything's possible.

724
01:04:49,344 --> 01:04:50,678
Look, uh...

725
01:04:50,763 --> 01:04:54,348
get some sleep. We'll straighten
all this out tomorrow.

726
01:05:20,209 --> 01:05:23,086
"Guide to Shell Beach
by Johnny Murdoch."

727
01:05:26,048 --> 01:05:27,882
Oh, come on.

728
01:05:46,443 --> 01:05:48,820
- Hello?
- Emma, he's here.

729
01:05:48,904 --> 01:05:50,988
He's acting mighty peculiar.

730
01:05:51,073 --> 01:05:53,116
I know. He's not himself.

731
01:05:53,200 --> 01:05:55,076
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

732
01:05:55,160 --> 01:05:57,495
- I'll try.
- Thanks, Karl. Bye.

733
01:06:00,040 --> 01:06:01,082
Johnny.

734
01:06:01,166 --> 01:06:03,000
I can't promise anything,
Mrs. Murdoch.

735
01:06:03,085 --> 01:06:04,585
We just have to play it as it comes.

736
01:06:04,670 --> 01:06:08,172
Johnny, we...
We just wanted to help. Ha.

737
01:06:15,013 --> 01:06:16,889
Karl.

738
01:06:16,974 --> 01:06:18,349
Uncle Karl.

739
01:06:18,433 --> 01:06:20,497
Johnny, if you're in
some kind of trouble...

740
01:06:20,498 --> 01:06:22,103
...well, maybe we could do something.

741
01:06:23,605 --> 01:06:26,065
Haven't seen you in so long.

742
01:06:26,441 --> 01:06:27,984
Yes.

743
01:07:30,130 --> 01:07:32,006
Argh! Oh!

744
01:07:40,641 --> 01:07:46,020
Mr. Murdoch... you've been
the cause of much distress.

745
01:07:50,067 --> 01:07:52,443
- Start talking.
- There's no need for this.

746
01:07:52,527 --> 01:07:53,861
There's no escape.

747
01:07:53,946 --> 01:07:55,905
The city's ours. We made it.

748
01:07:55,989 --> 01:07:57,448
What are you talking about?

749
01:07:57,532 --> 01:08:00,660
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories...

750
01:08:00,744 --> 01:08:04,538
different eras, different pasts
all rolled into one.

751
01:08:04,623 --> 01:08:07,083
Each night, we revise it, refine it...

752
01:08:07,167 --> 01:08:08,626
in order to learn.

753
01:08:08,710 --> 01:08:10,044
Learn what?

754
01:08:10,128 --> 01:08:11,545
About you, Mr. Murdoch...

755
01:08:11,630 --> 01:08:13,839
you and your fellow inhabitants...

756
01:08:13,924 --> 01:08:15,716
what makes you human.

757
01:08:16,260 --> 01:08:19,303
- Why?!
- We need to be like you.

758
01:08:20,264 --> 01:08:22,598
I understand you now, Mr. Murdoch.

759
01:08:22,683 --> 01:08:26,185
I remember that which you do not...
what you've been missing.

760
01:08:26,270 --> 01:08:27,937
The ocean, yes...

761
01:08:28,981 --> 01:08:31,565
running along the waves as a child...

762
01:08:31,650 --> 01:08:36,570
meeting Emma at the river...
That first kiss that followed.

763
01:08:37,197 --> 01:08:38,322
What are you?

764
01:08:38,407 --> 01:08:40,116
You've seen what we are.

765
01:08:40,200 --> 01:08:43,119
We use your dead as vessels.

766
01:09:26,663 --> 01:09:27,913
Ah! Ah!

767
01:09:29,583 --> 01:09:32,209
Aah!

768
01:09:50,145 --> 01:09:51,562
Aah!

769
01:10:04,326 --> 01:10:05,951
Uhh! Uhh!

770
01:10:52,833 --> 01:10:53,833
Get in!

771
01:11:09,307 --> 01:11:11,767
What about her? Ring any bells?

772
01:11:11,852 --> 01:11:13,144
She was alive when I left her.

773
01:11:13,228 --> 01:11:14,270
What about this?

774
01:11:14,354 --> 01:11:16,313
This is nothing. I... This is...

775
01:11:16,398 --> 01:11:18,649
It must mean something,
all those pictures.

776
01:11:18,733 --> 01:11:19,900
What pictures?

777
01:11:20,902 --> 01:11:21,902
I don't understand this.

778
01:11:21,987 --> 01:11:24,780
Stop playing games with me, Murdoch!
Stop telling me lies!

779
01:11:24,865 --> 01:11:26,323
I am not telling you lies!

780
01:11:26,408 --> 01:11:28,742
Help me out here.
Make me understand.

781
01:11:28,827 --> 01:11:30,870
I have this jigsaw puzzle
in front of my face...

782
01:11:30,954 --> 01:11:33,914
and every time I try to rearrange the
pieces, it still doesn't make any sense.

783
01:11:33,999 --> 01:11:35,332
What... You... You...
think it makes sense to me?

784
01:11:35,417 --> 01:11:37,418
I'm as much in the dark here as you are.

785
01:11:37,502 --> 01:11:39,670
You let me ask you a question?

786
01:11:40,755 --> 01:11:42,131
You heard of a place
called Shell Beach?

787
01:11:42,215 --> 01:11:44,675
- Sure.
- You know how to get there?

788
01:11:44,759 --> 01:11:46,135
- Yeah.
- You tell me?

789
01:11:46,219 --> 01:11:50,347
Oh, all right. You just, uh...
You go to the...

790
01:11:51,266 --> 01:11:52,266
Where? Where do you go?

791
01:11:52,350 --> 01:11:54,435
Just give me a second, will ya?

792
01:11:56,605 --> 01:11:58,272
You can't remember, can you?

793
01:12:00,609 --> 01:12:01,984
You think that's kind of odd?

794
01:12:02,068 --> 01:12:03,110
Hmm?

795
01:12:04,070 --> 01:12:05,029
Wait.

796
01:12:05,113 --> 01:12:06,447
I got a better one for you.

797
01:12:06,531 --> 01:12:07,781
When was the last time...

798
01:12:07,866 --> 01:12:10,701
you remember doing
something during the day?

799
01:12:10,785 --> 01:12:11,827
What do you mean?

800
01:12:11,912 --> 01:12:14,121
I just mean... during the day.

801
01:12:14,206 --> 01:12:16,207
Ha. Daylight.

802
01:12:16,291 --> 01:12:17,791
When was the last time
you remember seeing it?

803
01:12:17,876 --> 01:12:21,587
And I'm not talking about some distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

804
01:12:21,671 --> 01:12:24,757
I mean like yesterday?
Last week? When?

805
01:12:24,841 --> 01:12:27,259
Can you come up
with a single memory?

806
01:12:28,803 --> 01:12:30,054
You can't, can you?

807
01:12:30,138 --> 01:12:33,307
You know something?
I don't think the sun even...

808
01:12:33,391 --> 01:12:36,060
exists... in this place.

809
01:12:36,144 --> 01:12:40,356
'Cause I've been up for hours and hours
and hours and the night never ends here.

810
01:12:41,149 --> 01:12:43,734
- That is crazy.
- You're damn right this is crazy.

811
01:12:43,818 --> 01:12:46,195
Listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

812
01:12:46,279 --> 01:12:48,239
It's all of us.

813
01:12:48,323 --> 01:12:49,823
They're doing something to all of us.

814
01:12:49,908 --> 01:12:52,618
- Shut up, you... I've... I've
heard enough. - Please listen.

815
01:12:52,702 --> 01:12:54,453
- Shut up, will ya! Shut up!
- Listen to me.

816
01:13:04,673 --> 01:13:07,967
There has to be an explanation
for this somewhere.

817
01:13:16,101 --> 01:13:17,434
Explain this.

818
01:13:38,039 --> 01:13:40,249
John, I'm so sorry.

819
01:13:41,209 --> 01:13:43,002
I never meant to hurt you, John...

820
01:13:43,086 --> 01:13:44,169
and I did it,
and I don't know why I did.

821
01:13:44,254 --> 01:13:46,380
I wish I could take it all back.

822
01:13:46,464 --> 01:13:48,966
No. Emma... You didn't do it.

823
01:13:49,050 --> 01:13:51,760
This... affair of yours,
whatever it is...

824
01:13:51,845 --> 01:13:53,429
the thing you're
supposed to have done...

825
01:13:53,513 --> 01:13:55,306
you didn't do it.
I don't believe it ever happened.

826
01:13:55,390 --> 01:13:56,765
What do you mean?

827
01:13:56,850 --> 01:13:59,143
I know this is gonna sound crazy...

828
01:13:59,227 --> 01:14:02,146
but what if we never
knew each other before now?

829
01:14:02,230 --> 01:14:04,565
What if the first time we ever met...

830
01:14:04,649 --> 01:14:08,444
was last night in your...
in our apartment...

831
01:14:08,528 --> 01:14:11,405
and everything you remember...

832
01:14:11,489 --> 01:14:14,325
and everything that I'm supposed
to remember never really happened?

833
01:14:14,409 --> 01:14:16,952
Someone just wants us to think it did.

834
01:14:22,125 --> 01:14:24,501
You know, back in the apartment...

835
01:14:25,295 --> 01:14:27,755
I suddenly felt like
I didn't know you at all.

836
01:14:29,549 --> 01:14:32,051
It was as if you were a stranger.

837
01:14:34,304 --> 01:14:36,055
But how can that be true?

838
01:14:36,640 --> 01:14:40,726
I so vividly remember meeting you.

839
01:14:40,810 --> 01:14:43,854
I remember falling in love with you.

840
01:14:44,689 --> 01:14:46,482
I remember losing you.

841
01:14:46,858 --> 01:14:47,900
Time's up.

842
01:14:49,235 --> 01:14:50,694
No, wait, wait.

843
01:14:50,779 --> 01:14:52,863
Please, just...

844
01:14:52,947 --> 01:14:54,031
just one more minute.

845
01:15:00,538 --> 01:15:02,665
I love you, John.

846
01:15:05,502 --> 01:15:08,212
You can't fake something like that.

847
01:15:09,172 --> 01:15:10,506
No, you can't.

848
01:15:40,036 --> 01:15:42,621
Inspector? Sir?

849
01:15:43,998 --> 01:15:46,542
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

850
01:15:46,626 --> 01:15:50,379
I... Um... kind of thought
you should know.

851
01:15:53,007 --> 01:15:55,676
Oh, and...
the chief wanted to see you.

852
01:15:56,845 --> 01:15:58,011
Sir...

853
01:16:04,102 --> 01:16:06,103
I knew you'd track the killer down, sir.

854
01:16:17,699 --> 01:16:19,825
Um... sir...

855
01:16:21,745 --> 01:16:22,786
shoelace.

856
01:16:36,050 --> 01:16:37,134
How can we help you, sir?

857
01:16:37,218 --> 01:16:39,595
You can sleep.

858
01:16:41,723 --> 01:16:42,681
Gentlemen...

859
01:16:42,766 --> 01:16:44,349
Sleep. Sleep.

860
01:16:47,979 --> 01:16:49,229
Evening, sir.

861
01:16:58,114 --> 01:16:59,198
Bumstead.

862
01:17:02,035 --> 01:17:05,621
I wanted to be the first
to congratulate you... about the case.

863
01:17:08,333 --> 01:17:11,084
Take us to Murdoch.

864
01:17:11,169 --> 01:17:12,252
Sleep.

865
01:17:39,864 --> 01:17:41,198
Dr. Schreber.

866
01:17:41,282 --> 01:17:42,366
Ah.

867
01:17:42,450 --> 01:17:44,159
I knew you'd come eventually.

868
01:17:44,244 --> 01:17:46,870
Don't you think it's about time
you started giving me some answers?

869
01:17:46,955 --> 01:17:49,122
Yes. Yes, of course.

870
01:17:49,207 --> 01:17:50,958
Won't you please sit down?

871
01:17:54,045 --> 01:17:56,046
I... I come here quite often.

872
01:17:56,130 --> 01:17:58,549
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed a moment's peace.

873
01:17:58,633 --> 01:18:01,969
You... You see,
they have an aversion to... to water.

874
01:18:03,137 --> 01:18:05,556
One could almost call it a phobia.
Ha ha ha ha.

875
01:18:05,640 --> 01:18:08,892
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

876
01:18:08,977 --> 01:18:10,477
Right.

877
01:18:10,562 --> 01:18:12,563
Well, for now, let's just say...

878
01:18:12,647 --> 01:18:15,315
that you were the subject
of their experiment.

879
01:18:15,400 --> 01:18:16,775
W... We all are.

880
01:18:19,070 --> 01:18:20,988
You're not crazy, John.

881
01:18:21,781 --> 01:18:23,490
And you are not a murderer.

882
01:18:25,451 --> 01:18:27,160
I'm sorry about this. I truly am.

883
01:18:27,245 --> 01:18:28,745
But we do not have much time...

884
01:18:28,830 --> 01:18:31,415
and I cannot afford the luxury
of doing this the right way.

885
01:18:31,499 --> 01:18:32,958
Everything you need to know...

886
01:18:33,042 --> 01:18:35,335
all the answers
are in this syringe.

887
01:18:35,420 --> 01:18:36,587
I need you to inject yourself.

888
01:18:36,671 --> 01:18:39,006
It's the only way to
make you understand.

889
01:18:39,090 --> 01:18:40,340
You're kidding me, right?

890
01:18:40,425 --> 01:18:43,385
We're running out of time, John.
You have to do this now.

891
01:18:44,012 --> 01:18:45,429
Give me the gun, Doctor.

892
01:18:45,513 --> 01:18:47,890
Inspector, he is more
disturbed than we thought.

893
01:18:47,974 --> 01:18:50,642
I may not be the judge of personality
that you are, Doctor...

894
01:18:50,727 --> 01:18:53,687
but you're the one
who looks disturbed to me.

895
01:18:54,606 --> 01:18:56,398
You do not know
what you are doing.

896
01:18:57,609 --> 01:19:01,194
What, exactly is in this... Doctor?

897
01:19:02,947 --> 01:19:05,115
All the answers you've
been looking for, John.

898
01:19:05,199 --> 01:19:06,241
I swear to you.

899
01:19:06,326 --> 01:19:07,743
Uh-huh.

900
01:19:07,827 --> 01:19:12,831
Guess I'll just have to
hold on to it for... safekeeping.

901
01:19:12,916 --> 01:19:14,082
If you don't mind.

902
01:19:14,167 --> 01:19:15,542
Let's go, Doctor.

903
01:19:16,878 --> 01:19:22,215
- Go? Where are we going?
- Shell Beach.

904
01:19:23,301 --> 01:19:25,594
That's where you want to go, isn't it?

905
01:19:25,678 --> 01:19:27,262
The ocean.

906
01:19:36,314 --> 01:19:37,814
Why are you doing this?

907
01:19:39,525 --> 01:19:41,109
What do you hope to gain by helping me?

908
01:19:41,194 --> 01:19:42,736
The truth.

909
01:19:43,529 --> 01:19:46,448
None of these maps extend far enough
to show the ocean.

910
01:19:46,532 --> 01:19:47,866
You won't find anything there...

911
01:19:47,951 --> 01:19:49,826
I promise you!
I've been there, and...

912
01:19:49,911 --> 01:19:52,454
If you've been there,
you can show us the way, then, can't you?

913
01:19:53,581 --> 01:19:55,165
We'll see for ourselves.

914
01:19:56,250 --> 01:19:57,250
I won't.

915
01:19:58,419 --> 01:20:01,171
I refuse.
You... You can't make me go there!

916
01:20:02,590 --> 01:20:04,383
Ah!

917
01:20:05,051 --> 01:20:06,510
Ah!

918
01:20:06,594 --> 01:20:09,805
Ah! Ah!

919
01:20:13,393 --> 01:20:15,602
You were saying, doctor?

920
01:20:27,323 --> 01:20:30,867
I don't understand.
Used to be a bridge here.

921
01:20:37,625 --> 01:20:39,167
Try that again,
your friends are gonna be...

922
01:20:39,252 --> 01:20:40,544
fishing you out of the canal.

923
01:20:40,628 --> 01:20:41,962
Just don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

924
01:20:42,046 --> 01:20:44,089
It doesn't matter anymore anyway.

925
01:20:51,055 --> 01:20:53,306
What?

926
01:20:54,892 --> 01:20:57,227
Who are you people?

927
01:21:01,357 --> 01:21:05,902
We will give you some more
pretty things soon... Anna.

928
01:21:06,362 --> 01:21:07,571
I'm not Anna.

929
01:21:09,407 --> 01:21:11,324
You will be soon, yes.

930
01:21:15,413 --> 01:21:18,290
I have another use for her first.

931
01:21:25,006 --> 01:21:30,218
First there was darkness.
Then came the strangers.

932
01:21:32,388 --> 01:21:34,681
They abducted us
and brought us here.

933
01:21:35,975 --> 01:21:38,685
This city, everyone in it...

934
01:21:38,770 --> 01:21:40,103
is their experiment.

935
01:21:40,188 --> 01:21:43,023
They mix and match
our memories as they see fit...

936
01:21:43,107 --> 01:21:45,859
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

937
01:21:46,569 --> 01:21:49,279
One day, a man
might be an inspector.

938
01:21:49,363 --> 01:21:52,282
The next, someone entirely different.

939
01:21:52,366 --> 01:21:55,619
When they want to
study a murderer for instance...

940
01:21:55,703 --> 01:21:59,498
they simply imprint one of their citizens
with a new personality...

941
01:22:00,625 --> 01:22:04,628
arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

942
01:22:05,421 --> 01:22:06,463
even a lost wallet.

943
01:22:07,048 --> 01:22:08,715
Then they observe the results.

944
01:22:10,176 --> 01:22:14,221
Will a man, given the history
of a killer, continue in that vein?

945
01:22:14,305 --> 01:22:18,266
Or are we, in fact, more
than the mere sum of our memories?

946
01:22:18,351 --> 01:22:23,313
This business of you being a killer
was an unhappy coincidence.

947
01:22:23,397 --> 01:22:26,191
You have had dozens
of lives before now.

948
01:22:26,275 --> 01:22:29,611
You just happened to wake up
while I was imprinting you with this one.

949
01:22:30,404 --> 01:22:32,489
Why are they doing all of this?

950
01:22:32,573 --> 01:22:35,909
It is our capacity for individuality...

951
01:22:35,993 --> 01:22:38,495
our souls that makes
us different from them.

952
01:22:38,579 --> 01:22:40,914
They think they
can find the human soul...

953
01:22:40,998 --> 01:22:44,084
if they understand
how our memories work.

954
01:22:44,168 --> 01:22:45,377
All they have
are collective memories.

955
01:22:45,461 --> 01:22:48,255
They share one group mind.

956
01:22:48,339 --> 01:22:49,756
They're dying, you see?

957
01:22:49,841 --> 01:22:53,218
Their entire race
is on the brink of extinction.

958
01:22:53,302 --> 01:22:55,137
They think we can save them.

959
01:22:55,221 --> 01:22:57,639
- Where do I fit in?
- You are different, John.

960
01:22:58,266 --> 01:23:01,101
You resisted my attempt
to imprint you.

961
01:23:05,773 --> 01:23:09,109
Somehow you have developed
their ability to tune.

962
01:23:09,193 --> 01:23:10,402
That is how they change things.

963
01:23:10,486 --> 01:23:11,987
That is how they built this city.

964
01:23:12,071 --> 01:23:14,948
They have machines buried deep
beneath the surface...

965
01:23:15,032 --> 01:23:18,952
that allow them
to focus their telepathic energies.

966
01:23:19,829 --> 01:23:22,247
They control everything here,
even the sun.

967
01:23:22,331 --> 01:23:25,667
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

968
01:23:25,751 --> 01:23:26,960
So why do they need you?

969
01:23:27,044 --> 01:23:31,381
When they first brought us here,
they extracted what was in us.

970
01:23:31,465 --> 01:23:35,260
So they could store the information,
remix it like so much paint...

971
01:23:35,344 --> 01:23:37,846
and give us back new memories
of their choosing.

972
01:23:37,930 --> 01:23:41,558
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

973
01:23:43,394 --> 01:23:46,521
I understood the intricacies
of the human mind...

974
01:23:46,606 --> 01:23:49,065
better than they ever could...

975
01:23:49,150 --> 01:23:51,860
so they allowed me
to keep my skills as a scientist...

976
01:23:51,944 --> 01:23:53,320
because they needed them.

977
01:23:53,404 --> 01:23:55,864
But they made me
delete everything else.

978
01:24:00,411 --> 01:24:02,245
Ah! Ah!

979
01:24:04,248 --> 01:24:07,042
Can you imagine what
it is like being forced...

980
01:24:07,126 --> 01:24:08,793
to erase your own past?

981
01:24:08,878 --> 01:24:12,214
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

982
01:24:13,132 --> 01:24:15,842
Shell Beach, Uncle Karl.

983
01:24:16,594 --> 01:24:17,886
What about this?

984
01:24:18,804 --> 01:24:20,639
This was blank when I found it!

985
01:24:20,723 --> 01:24:22,724
You still don't understand, John.

986
01:24:22,808 --> 01:24:25,936
You were never a boy...
not in this place.

987
01:24:26,020 --> 01:24:28,772
Your entire history is an illusion,
a fabrication...

988
01:24:28,856 --> 01:24:30,690
as it is with all of us.

989
01:24:30,775 --> 01:24:33,235
You made those drawings
happen with your gift.

990
01:24:33,319 --> 01:24:35,195
You say they brought us here.

991
01:24:36,989 --> 01:24:38,156
From where?

992
01:24:41,953 --> 01:24:42,994
I'm sorry.

993
01:24:44,121 --> 01:24:45,830
I don't remember.

994
01:24:45,915 --> 01:24:47,666
None of us remember that...

995
01:24:48,376 --> 01:24:49,918
what we once were...

996
01:24:50,002 --> 01:24:52,379
what we might have been...

997
01:24:52,463 --> 01:24:53,838
somewhere else.

998
01:25:11,315 --> 01:25:13,233
I've taken you this far.

999
01:25:13,317 --> 01:25:15,402
You don't need me anymore.

1000
01:25:15,486 --> 01:25:17,279
Let's go.

1001
01:25:35,506 --> 01:25:37,299
John.

1002
01:26:01,407 --> 01:26:04,159
There is no ocean, John.

1003
01:26:04,243 --> 01:26:08,330
There is nothing beyond the city.

1004
01:26:08,414 --> 01:26:11,750
The only place home exists...

1005
01:26:13,586 --> 01:26:15,587
is in your head.

1006
01:26:23,929 --> 01:26:25,638
No! No!

1007
01:26:25,723 --> 01:26:27,515
John, stop!

1008
01:26:30,102 --> 01:26:31,227
No!

1009
01:26:33,939 --> 01:26:35,231
Stop!

1010
01:26:40,905 --> 01:26:42,113
Please!

1011
01:26:42,948 --> 01:26:44,157
No!

1012
01:26:47,244 --> 01:26:48,661
- Aah!
- Uhh!

1013
01:27:02,635 --> 01:27:04,803
And now you know the truth.

1014
01:27:20,069 --> 01:27:21,528
Aaah!

1015
01:27:21,612 --> 01:27:23,029
Aah!

1016
01:27:24,156 --> 01:27:25,365
No!

1017
01:27:25,449 --> 01:27:26,491
Aah!

1018
01:27:26,575 --> 01:27:27,951
Aaaah!

1019
01:28:13,414 --> 01:28:16,291
You'll allow yourself
to surrender, Mr. Murdoch...

1020
01:28:16,375 --> 01:28:18,543
or it will result in
this one's death, yes?

1021
01:28:18,627 --> 01:28:21,129
What do I care?
She's not my real wife!

1022
01:28:21,213 --> 01:28:22,297
She's nothing to me!

1023
01:28:22,381 --> 01:28:26,551
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

1024
01:28:26,635 --> 01:28:29,262
You see, I have
become the monster...

1025
01:28:29,346 --> 01:28:31,306
you were intended to be.

1026
01:28:31,390 --> 01:28:33,057
Uhh!

1027
01:28:33,142 --> 01:28:37,061
Shall I end her life now
as you would have?

1028
01:28:40,107 --> 01:28:42,275
Don't hurt her, please!

1029
01:28:42,359 --> 01:28:46,946
Then surrender, Mr. Murdoch.

1030
01:28:47,031 --> 01:28:48,656
Sleep.

1031
01:28:50,493 --> 01:28:52,702
Now.

1032
01:28:54,497 --> 01:28:56,206
John?

1033
01:29:11,222 --> 01:29:12,388
Sleep.

1034
01:29:34,245 --> 01:29:37,121
The doctor was right.
He has evolved.

1035
01:29:37,498 --> 01:29:38,957
Kill him.

1036
01:29:39,041 --> 01:29:40,708
Kill him!
Kill him!

1037
01:29:44,838 --> 01:29:47,549
Kill him! Kill him!

1038
01:29:50,219 --> 01:29:52,720
He is powerful, yes.

1039
01:29:52,805 --> 01:29:57,225
Dangerous. But he can also
lead us to what we seek.

1040
01:29:57,309 --> 01:30:00,645
What the doctor calls the soul.

1041
01:30:00,729 --> 01:30:04,399
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

1042
01:30:04,483 --> 01:30:07,151
We no longer need
the other subjects.

1043
01:30:07,236 --> 01:30:10,822
The time for study is over.

1044
01:30:10,906 --> 01:30:15,118
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

1045
01:30:21,792 --> 01:30:23,585
It is time, Doctor.

1046
01:30:23,669 --> 01:30:25,211
Imprint.

1047
01:30:28,007 --> 01:30:30,717
Shut it down!

1048
01:30:30,801 --> 01:30:33,970
Shut it down forever!

1049
01:30:47,860 --> 01:30:50,069
What are you doing?

1050
01:30:50,154 --> 01:30:54,699
They want to imprint you
with their own collective memories.

1051
01:30:56,035 --> 01:31:00,163
They want to make you one of them,
so they can share your soul.

1052
01:31:06,337 --> 01:31:08,588
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

1053
01:31:08,672 --> 01:31:10,465
I'm sorry, John.

1054
01:31:10,549 --> 01:31:13,551
The pain will only last a moment.

1055
01:31:15,679 --> 01:31:16,638
No!

1056
01:31:25,064 --> 01:31:26,356
Remember, John.

1057
01:31:27,608 --> 01:31:29,525
You'll rise to greater
heights than that, my boy.

1058
01:31:29,610 --> 01:31:31,402
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

1059
01:31:33,155 --> 01:31:34,489
Remember.

1060
01:31:35,616 --> 01:31:38,409
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

1061
01:31:38,494 --> 01:31:41,663
Now remember
what I told you. Never talk to strangers.

1062
01:31:41,747 --> 01:31:43,498
John, remember.

1063
01:31:43,582 --> 01:31:46,376
You're probably wondering why I keep
appearing in your memories.

1064
01:31:46,460 --> 01:31:48,961
It is because I have
inserted myself in them.

1065
01:31:49,046 --> 01:31:51,089
All of these memories
have been fabricated...

1066
01:31:51,173 --> 01:31:52,840
to teach you about the strangers.

1067
01:31:52,925 --> 01:31:56,052
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

1068
01:31:58,889 --> 01:32:01,224
You will survive, John.

1069
01:32:01,308 --> 01:32:03,559
You will find strength
within yourself...

1070
01:32:03,644 --> 01:32:05,561
and you will prevail.

1071
01:32:05,646 --> 01:32:06,979
Remember.

1072
01:32:07,773 --> 01:32:08,731
Hi, Uncle Karl.

1073
01:32:08,816 --> 01:32:09,816
Johnny!

1074
01:32:12,820 --> 01:32:14,862
You're getting the hang of it, John.

1075
01:32:14,947 --> 01:32:16,989
Maybe one day
I'll be working for you.

1076
01:32:17,825 --> 01:32:20,993
This is the machine the strangers use
to amplify their thoughts.

1077
01:32:21,078 --> 01:32:22,912
The machine
that changes their world.

1078
01:32:22,996 --> 01:32:24,497
You must take control of it.

1079
01:32:24,581 --> 01:32:26,165
You must make the machine yours.

1080
01:32:26,250 --> 01:32:28,334
I know you can beat them, John.

1081
01:32:28,419 --> 01:32:30,920
But you must concentrate.

1082
01:32:33,132 --> 01:32:34,215
Something's wrong.

1083
01:32:38,846 --> 01:32:40,513
Aah!

1084
01:32:42,850 --> 01:32:45,560
There is no time for romance, John.

1085
01:32:45,644 --> 01:32:47,937
The world can be what you make it.

1086
01:32:48,021 --> 01:32:49,981
What have you done?

1087
01:32:50,065 --> 01:32:52,567
You have the power
to make anything happen...

1088
01:32:52,651 --> 01:32:54,152
but you must act now!

1089
01:34:13,941 --> 01:34:16,526
- Ahhhhh!
- Ahhhhhh!

1090
01:34:17,528 --> 01:34:18,945
Ahhhhh!

1091
01:34:35,379 --> 01:34:39,257
- Aaaahhh!
- Aaaah!

1092
01:34:55,774 --> 01:34:57,900
Aah!

1093
01:35:13,125 --> 01:35:16,168
Aah!

1094
01:35:21,758 --> 01:35:23,676
Aah!

1095
01:35:26,263 --> 01:35:27,388
Aah!

1096
01:35:30,851 --> 01:35:32,351
- Aah!
- Aah!

1097
01:36:41,922 --> 01:36:43,464
Raah!

1098
01:36:45,592 --> 01:36:47,885
Aah!

1099
01:37:39,021 --> 01:37:40,438
I knew you could do it, John.

1100
01:37:40,522 --> 01:37:42,523
You have their power now.

1101
01:37:42,607 --> 01:37:44,400
You control their machines.

1102
01:37:44,484 --> 01:37:45,901
Where's Emma?

1103
01:37:46,653 --> 01:37:49,405
She is not Emma anymore, John.

1104
01:37:49,489 --> 01:37:50,865
She has been reimprinted.

1105
01:37:50,949 --> 01:37:52,575
So give her back her memories.

1106
01:37:52,659 --> 01:37:55,077
I can't. The facility
where the strangers...

1107
01:37:55,162 --> 01:37:58,080
stored the memories
has been destroyed.

1108
01:37:58,165 --> 01:38:00,291
I'm sorry.

1109
01:38:00,375 --> 01:38:03,085
What are you going to do now, John?

1110
01:38:04,838 --> 01:38:08,632
You told me I had
the power, didn't you?

1111
01:38:09,009 --> 01:38:11,510
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

1112
01:38:13,180 --> 01:38:15,514
Make this world anything
I want it to be.

1113
01:38:16,516 --> 01:38:19,560
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

1114
01:39:44,437 --> 01:39:45,813
Where are you going?

1115
01:39:48,775 --> 01:39:50,234
Shell Beach.

1116
01:40:31,109 --> 01:40:32,484
- What's the fare?
- Quarter.

1117
01:40:38,742 --> 01:40:39,700
Oh, please.

1118
01:40:39,784 --> 01:40:42,244
- Oh, no...
- It's fine.

1119
01:40:42,329 --> 01:40:43,746
- Thank you.
- OK.

1120
01:41:23,954 --> 01:41:25,829
John...

1121
01:41:29,376 --> 01:41:31,543
Been waiting for you, yes?

1122
01:41:32,254 --> 01:41:33,337
What are you doing?

1123
01:41:33,421 --> 01:41:36,757
I'm just making a few little changes
around here, is all.

1124
01:41:36,841 --> 01:41:38,550
Are we sure that's what we want?

1125
01:41:39,052 --> 01:41:41,470
I'm prepared to take my chances.

1126
01:41:41,554 --> 01:41:42,972
I'm dying, John.

1127
01:41:43,056 --> 01:41:46,058
Your imprint is not
agreeable with my kind.

1128
01:41:47,519 --> 01:41:49,770
But I wanted to know
what it was like...

1129
01:41:51,147 --> 01:41:52,606
how you feel.

1130
01:41:52,691 --> 01:41:55,317
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

1131
01:41:55,402 --> 01:41:59,154
That person isn't me.
Never was.

1132
01:41:59,239 --> 01:42:02,950
You wanted to know what it was
about us that made us human.

1133
01:42:04,327 --> 01:42:07,663
Well, you're not going
to find it... in here.

1134
01:42:09,416 --> 01:42:12,042
You went looking
in the wrong place.

1135
01:43:50,433 --> 01:43:52,351
It's so beautiful here.

1136
01:43:57,690 --> 01:43:59,149
So bright.

1137
01:44:05,031 --> 01:44:07,825
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

1138
01:44:07,909 --> 01:44:10,536
I think that's it just over there.

1139
01:44:28,721 --> 01:44:30,764
I'm headed that way myself.

1140
01:44:32,725 --> 01:44:34,726
Would you like to join me?

1141
01:44:36,896 --> 01:44:37,896
Sure.

1142
01:44:43,611 --> 01:44:45,904
I'm Anna, by the way.

1143
01:44:45,989 --> 01:44:48,240
- What's your name?
- John.

1144
01:44:50,660 --> 01:44:52,119
John Murdoch.

1145
01:49:40,700 --> 01:49:44,536
# When marimba rhythms
start to play #

1146
01:49:44,620 --> 01:49:47,122
# Dance with me #

1147
01:49:47,206 --> 01:49:49,750
# Make me sway #

1148
01:49:49,834 --> 01:49:54,129
# Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore #

1149
01:49:54,213 --> 01:49:56,256
# Hold me close #

1150
01:49:56,340 --> 01:49:59,301
# Sway me more #

1151
01:49:59,385 --> 01:50:03,472
# Like a flower
bending in the breeze #

1152
01:50:03,556 --> 01:50:05,807
# Bend with me #

1153
01:50:05,892 --> 01:50:08,810
# Sway with ease #

1154
01:50:08,895 --> 01:50:13,148
# When we dance
you have a way with me #

1155
01:50:13,232 --> 01:50:15,150
# Stay with me #

1156
01:50:15,234 --> 01:50:18,069
# Sway with me #

1157
01:50:18,154 --> 01:50:22,866
# Other dancers may be on the floor #

1158
01:50:22,950 --> 01:50:27,621
# Dear, but my eyes will see only you #

1159
01:50:27,705 --> 01:50:32,334
# Only you have that
magic technique #

1160
01:50:32,418 --> 01:50:37,005
# When we sway I go weak #

1161
01:50:37,089 --> 01:50:41,009
# I can hear the sound of violins #

1162
01:50:41,093 --> 01:50:46,348
# Long before it begins #

1163
01:50:46,432 --> 01:50:50,519
# Make me thrill
as only you know how #

1164
01:50:50,603 --> 01:50:56,691
# Sway me smooth, sway me now #

1165
01:50:56,776 --> 01:51:01,863
# Sway me now #

1166
01:51:04,617 --> 01:51:07,953
# Sway me smooth #

1167
01:51:13,584 --> 01:51:19,506
# Sway me now #
